intro: Octomeria tenuis, commonly known as the slender octomeris, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Octomeria tenuis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
